description: Valeritas is a medical technology company based in Bridgewater, NJ, specializing in improving health and simplifying life for people with diabetes. They have developed the V-Go Wearable Insulin Delivery Device, designed for adult patients with Type 2 diabetes requiring insulin. This device allows for continuous insulin delivery and on-demand dosing, making diabetes management more convenient for users. V-Go is cleared for use in the U.S. and the E.U. and aims to help patients achieve better blood glucose control. The company's headquarters is located at 750 Route 202 South, Bridgewater, NJ 08807. Specific hours of operation are not mentioned. Requirements for using V-Go typically involve being an adult patient with Type 2 diabetes needing insulin therapy.

The center offers 24/7 services and provides a range of outpatient addiction treatment programs, including Day Treatment, Intensive Outpatient Programs (IOP), Outpatient Programs (OP), and specialized services for working professionals and individuals with dual diagnoses. 

The center emphasizes personalized care, innovative treatment approaches, and integrated support for both substance use and mental health conditions. Accreditation by JCAHO and CARF underscores their commitment to high standards of care. 

To begin the admissions process or for inquiries, prospective clients can call (855) 924-5320 or visit their website. No specific requirements for admission are mentioned, but services are targeted at individuals aged 18 and older.

service: Veteran's Clothing Closet (Catholic Charities Diocese of Paterson
description: The Veteran's Clothing Closet, operated by Catholic Charities in the Diocese of Paterson, provides free clothing, hygiene products, and small household items to veterans. description: The Veterans Crisis Line provides 24/7, confidential crisis support for Veterans, service members, and their loved ones. Help is accessible by dialing 988 and pressing 1, chatting online, or texting 838255. You do not need to be enrolled in VA benefits or health care to receive support. The service connects individuals with qualified responders who can listen and offer assistance, as well as link them to additional resources for ongoing help. This service is available year-round, offering free support without any location limitations. For those calling from overseas, specific numbers are provided for different U.S. military regions.
action: Dial 988 then Press 1 for immediate crisis support.

description: The Vermeule Mansion, also known as the Van Deventer–Brunson House, is a historic house located at 614 Greenbrook Road in North Plainfield, New Jersey. It is recognized for its architectural significance, having been added to the National Register of Historic Places on October 27, 2004. The mansion features Second Empire and Colonial Revival styles and spans an area of 5.3 acres. It now serves as the Vermeule Community Center and houses The Fleetwood Museum of Art and Photographica, which showcases a camera collection and oil paintings. Specific hours of operation and any visitor requirements are not detailed in the summary provided.
address: 614 Greenbrook Road, North Plainfield, New Jersey
action: Visit the Vermeule Community Center in North Plainfield, New Jersey.

Eligibility for certain programs may require proof of military service and honorable discharge. Free flu vaccines are available at local VA sites for enrolled veterans.

description: The Vineland Soup Kitchen, operated by Spirit & Truth Ministries, Inc., is located in the basement of the First United Methodist Church at the corner of 7th and Landis Avenues in Vineland, Cumberland County, NJ. It is the only free soup kitchen in the city, providing food assistance to low-income, food insecure, and homeless individuals. The kitchen operates Monday through Friday, serving breakfast from 8:00 am to 9:00 am and lunch from 10:00 am to 11:30 am. In addition to meals, the kitchen offers personal care items during winter and collaborates with social service groups from April to October. Volunteers and donations are encouraged to support their mission.

It's advisable to check their website or contact them directly for the most accurate and updated information regarding hours and appointment requirements.

description:
The New Jersey Division of Taxation offers free tax preparation services through two main programs: the Volunteer Income Tax Assistance (VITA) and the Tax Counseling for the Elderly (TCE) programs. VITA is available for low- to moderate-income individuals, people with disabilities, and non-English speaking taxpayers, while TCE focuses on providing assistance to individuals aged 60 and older. 

Preparation sites across the state are staffed by trained volunteers who assist with both federal and state tax returns, typically filing them electronically for accuracy. To find a VITA site, individuals can call the IRS at 1-800-906-9887 or use the IRS Site Locator online. For TCE, inquiries can be directed to AARP at 1-888-AARP-NOW.

Hours of operation and specific site locations vary, so it is advisable to contact or check the resources for the most current information. There are no specific requirements beyond those outlined for each program.
action: Call the IRS at 1-800-906-9887 to find a nearby VITA site for free tax preparation assistance.

description: The New Jersey Department of Health's Vital Statistics office, located at 140 E. Front Street, Trenton, NJ, offers services related to the registration and recording of vital events, including birth, marriage, death, domestic partnership, civil union, and adoption records. The office maintains records starting from 1925 for births and 1951 for marriages and deaths. Customers can order vital records online through VitalChek, by calling 877-622-7549, or by visiting the walk-in center for same-day service. Important to note, New Jersey law restricts access to vital records, which are not considered public records. Hours of operation for the walk-in center are not specified, and users should check for acceptable identification forms and additional requirements.
action: Order a vital record through VitalChek's online service.

description:
The New Jersey Division of Vocational Rehabilitation Services (DVRS) provides support and services for individuals with disabilities to achieve employment outcomes that align with their strengths and needs. 

**Location:** DVRS has multiple field offices across New Jersey, including Atlantic, Bergen, Burlington, Camden, and more counties. An administrative office is located at 1 John Fitch Plaza, PO Box 398, Trenton, NJ 08625-0398.

**Hours:** Specific hours may vary by location, but interested individuals are encouraged to call their local office for information or to schedule an appointment.

**Requirements:** To qualify for services, individuals must have a documented disability that presents a significant barrier to employment. Services include career counseling, job search assistance, training opportunities, and specialized support for various groups, including youth and veterans. Some services are provided at no cost, while others may require a financial need assessment. 

For more information, individuals can call the toll-free number: 1-866-871-7867 or visit the website for specific field office contact details.

Division of Vocational Rehabilitation Services

description:
The Camden County Warming Centers provide shelter during severe weather conditions when the temperature is 32 degrees or lower. Activation occurs through local municipalities as part of their Code Blue response plans. Each municipality has designated its own location for those in need, particularly homeless or transient populations. 

Individuals seeking shelter must contact their local municipality or the Camden County Department of Health and Human Services at 856-374-6037. The hours and capacities of various centers vary. Some centers operate 24/7, while others have specific days and hours. Notably, Joseph’s House and Proctor Properties in Camden offer services specifically for Camden City residents.

description:
Camden County, NJ provides warming centers for individuals seeking shelter during severe weather emergencies, specifically when temperatures drop to 32°F or below. Residents can access these centers by contacting their local municipality. The Camden County Health Department collaborates with municipalities to activate their Code Blue response plans.

Warming centers have varied operating hours and capacities, and each location caters to specific communities. For example:
- **Joseph’s House** in Camden operates 24/7 for Camden City residents only with a capacity of 10.
- **Cherry Hill Mall** is open from 11 AM to 8 PM (Mon-Thurs), 10 AM to 9 PM (Fri & Sat), and 11 AM to 6 PM (Sun), accommodating an unlimited number of individuals.
- **Audubon Senior Center** operates as needed, while several libraries also serve as warming centers during the specified hours.

For additional assistance, individuals can call the Camden County Department of Health and Human Services at 856-374-6037.
action: Contact your local municipality or call the Camden County Department of Health and Human Services at 856-374-6037 to find the nearest warming center.

service: Work First New Jersey (WFNJ): Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF) an
description:
Work First New Jersey (WFNJ) is New Jersey's cash assistance program that offers monthly cash benefits, child care, job search assistance, and short-term housing support for eligible residents. The program includes two main components: Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (WFNJ/TANF) for families, and General Assistance (WFNJ/GA) for single adults and couples without children. 

Location: The program is managed by the Department of Human Services, with its main office located at 222 South Warren Street, PO Box 700, Trenton, NJ 08625-0700.

Hours: The specific hours of operation are not mentioned on the website.

Requirements: Eligibility for WFNJ benefits is determined based on individual circumstances. Interested individuals can learn more about the program and check their eligibility in the 'GET WFNJ' section of the site. Additionally, recipients can protect their benefits via an EBT card Lock/Unlock feature to prevent theft.
address:
222 South Warren Street  
PO Box 700  
Trenton, NJ 08625-0700
action: Visit the "GET WFNJ" section of the site to check your eligibility for Work First New Jersey services.

description:
The New Jersey Code Blue program, operated by NJ 2-1-1, provides emergency shelter and warming centers during severe cold weather to protect unsheltered individuals. The program activates Code Blue notifications when temperatures drop to freezing or lower, allowing counties to create shelter arrangements. Warming centers, often located in public libraries and community centers, are available during business hours, with additional overnight options listed as well.

Contact NJ 2-1-1 for assistance 24/7 by dialing 2-1-1 or 877-652-1148, or text your zip code to 898-211. Various shelter locations are available across counties in New Jersey, specifically for residents and specific groups, including single men without psychotropic medications in some cases.
